alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 25 at 4:47AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...PERIODS OF HEAVY SNOW AND STRONG WINDS CONTINUE ALONG PARTS OF THE SEWARD HIGHWAY THROUGH TONIGHT... Snow continues through Turnagain Pass this morning with the heaviest snowfall expected this morning. Steady east winds with gusts to 40 mph possible will combine with the snow to reduce visibilities creating whiteout conditions at times. An additional foot of snow is expected over Turnagain Pass. While snow rates will diminish some later this evening, moderate snow is expected to continue through at least early Saturday morning. Rain will continue to mix with snow at sea level through the day. Temperatures will start to cool Friday evening and allow precipitation to become all snow. Please check conditions before you go and use caution while traveling. For the latest forecast, visit www.weather.gov/afc. For the latest road conditions, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
